quote_first: The whipped mules dragged the wagon on through a flooded branch that submerged thirty yards of the road and stood up around the bushes and tree-trunks on either side so that they had no rootage, and I watched where and how deep the wheels went while I idled the motor and lighter Gudgerâ€™s and my own cigarette. It was
title: Let Us Now Praise Famous Men
author: James Agee and Walker Evans
